title.narrative: Delivering Emergency Health Services for IDPs and Communities in Rakhine

description.narrative:
1) To provide essential life-saving services to the most vulnerable populations in two IDP camps and 50 hard-to-reach villages;
Key deliverables:
- Two mobile health teams visiting IDP camps for six months
- Essential medicines distributed to IDPs
- Emergency referrals supported for IDPs and 50 hard-to-reach villages
- 50 villages identified as hard-to-reach against key criteria
2) To support the implementation of immunisation and nutrition campaigns in two IDP camps and 50 hard-to-reach villages;
Key deliverables:
- 104 Community Health Workers trained to improve delivery of essential health services
- At least two visits to each hard-to-reach village and IDP camps for immunisation and nutrition campaigns
- 2,362 children receiving nutritional supplements - 80 pregnant and lactating women IDPs receiving nutritional supplements
- 5,762 children under 5 years old receiving routine immunizations (five-in-one pentavalent vaccine; and measles)
3) To promote health seeking behavior in two IDP camps and in 50 hard-to-reach villages,
Key deliverables:
- 100 health education sessions provided by BHS, volunteer health workers and RI
- 30 volunteer health workers to trained on behavior change communication strategies
To improve access to life-saving interventions, nutrition and immunization for IDPs and hard-to-reach communities
